activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick A McDaniel

defendant.name: McDaniel, Derrick A
defendant.address: 9199 N Indian Trail Ave, Hayward, WI 54843

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Fax Transmittal to Sawyer County Jail with Bond for Administration
Copy of Signed, NOT POSTED, Cash Bond from Sawyer County Sheriff's Office with Cover Letter
Notice of Court Order to Dispatch with Bond
An additional $200 will need to be posted to be released

[ma] Case called at 2:12pm{This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel appeared by zoom from Sawyer County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Kayla Barteck appeared by zoom for Derrick A McDaniel.  Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty Barteck gives explanation for Mr. McDaniel's non appearance. 
ADA Beck requests bond be forfeited.

The Court reinstates the previously posted $50 cash bond, and requires an additional $200 cash be posted. 

recess: 2:20pm
NEXT: Plea & Sentencing on 12/22/22 at 2:30pm via zoom
Completion of Representation - Att Nelson

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
case called at 2:04pm 
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel not in court.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Status Conference.  
Attorney Nelson indicates that she has not been able to reach Mr. McDaniel today; she does not have information regarding the non-appearance.
The Court orders a Bench Warrant-body only, returnable to a Jefferson County magistrate.
The Court finds the $50 Cash Bond to be in default.
ADA Shock Motions for Bail Forfeiture.
recess 2:06pm

NEXT:  schedule Bail Forfeiture Hearing
Attorney Opt in Letter
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:47 PM 
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in court with Attorney Kayla Barteck.   Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes warrnat based on Mr. McDaniel's appearance is today.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel. 

Defendant confirms Hayward address.

The Court requires a $50 CASH bond. 

recess: 2:52pm 
NEXT: Status on 9/2/22 at 2:00pm via zoom
Voluntary appearance on June 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Set for V/A
Voluntary Appearance Request
Returnable any Jefferson County Judge or Magistrate.

[ml] Case called at 9:41AM
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel DOES NOT appear. Attorney Kayla Barteck appears. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes the Defendant's non-appearance and affirms that today's hearing has been sufficiently noticed.

Att Barteck advises that the Defendant is likely in custody, citing Vinelink updates, however she does not know the Defendant's exact whereabouts.

On Motion of the State, the Court issues a Bench Warrant, Body Only returnable any Jefferson County Judge or Magistrate.

The Court does not finds bond in default for reasons stated on the record.

recess 9:43AM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Barteck
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No Special Conditions

[ml] Case called at 2:31PM
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson(the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.
The Court finds Probable Cause to exists on the Criminal Compliant.

The Court requires a $500.00 Signature Bond with no special conditions.

recess 2:36PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 04/06 at 10:40AM   (2) Status Conference on 06/02 at 9:30AM in Branch III

[ae] case called 08:43 AM Defendant Derrick A McDaniel not in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and issues warrant body only.  
Recess 8:44 AM
